sen.j: 下毛野 古麻呂（しもつけぬ の こまろ、？ - 710年1月28日（和銅2年12月20日 (旧暦)））は、飛鳥時代から奈良時代にかけての貴族。
sen.e: SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro (his birth date unknown -January 28, 710) was a noble who lived from Asuka period to Nara period.

sen.cmt: ・念のため、旧暦も併記しました。
sen.e: SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro (his birth date unknown - January 28, 710) was a noble who lived from Asuka period to Nara period.

sen.j: 父は下毛野久志麻呂。
sen.e: His father was SHIMOTSUKENU no Kushimaro.
His father was SHIMOTSUKENU no Kushimaro.

sen.j: 名は子麻呂あるいは子麿とも書く。
sen.e: His name was written not only as "古麻呂" but also as "子麻呂" or "子麿 " in Kanji (Chinese character), though both have the same reading.

sen.j: 本姓は下毛野朝臣。
sen.e: His main name was SHIMOTSUKENU no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 下毛野古麻呂は毛野氏の一族で、下野国の国造家である下毛野君を祖とする貴族である。
sen.e: SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro was from a family of the Keno clan and a noble, whose ancestor was SHIMOTSUKENU no kimi, Kuninomiyatsuko (the heads of local governments) of Shimotsuke Province.
SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro was from a family of the Kenu uji clan and a noble, whose ancestor was SHIMOTSUKENU no kimi, Kuninomiyatsuko (the heads of local governments) of Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: ・「毛野氏」は下記のサイトによると「けぬうじ」と読むそうです。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%AF%9B%E9%87%8E%E6%B0%8F
sen.e: SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro was from a family of the Kenu uji clan and a noble, whose ancestor was SHIMOTSUKENU no kimi, Kuninomiyatsuko (the heads of local governments) of Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 下野国河内郡 (栃木県)を本拠地とし、天武天皇から持統天皇の時代には藤原不比等らとともに大宝律令の選定に関わり、功田封戸を下賜される。
sen.e: He was based in Kawachi County, Shimotsuke Province (present Tochigi Prefecture) and in the reigns from Emperor Tenmu to Empress Jito, he was involved in selection of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) with FUJIWARA no Fuhito and granted Kuden fuko (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state as a salary).

sen.j: 参議を令せられたほか、兵部卿や造山陵司、式部卿を歴任した。
sen.e: He received order to be Sangi (councillor) and held various posts such as Hyobukyo (Minister for Military Affairs), Misasagitsukurutsukasa (official who was responsible for building the imperial tomb) and Shikibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 最終官位は正四位下式部卿大将軍。
sen.e: His last official rank was Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Shikibukyo Daishogun (command-in-chief).

sen.j: 下野国河内郡に薬師寺 (下野市)を建立し氏寺としたと云われる。
sen.e: It is believed that he erected Yakushi-ji Temple in Kawachi County, Shimotsuke Province (current Shimotsuke City) and made it Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory).

sen.j: 689年（持統天皇3年）10月22日 (旧暦) - 直廣肆であった古麻呂は奴婢600人の解放を奏上し、許可される。
sen.e: On December 12, 689, Komaro who was Jikikoshi (equivalent to Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) reported the liberation of 600 Nuhi (slaves) to the Emperor and received permission.

On December 12, 689, or October 22 on the old calendar, Komaro who was Jikikoshi (equivalent to Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) reported the liberation of 600 Nuhi (slaves) to the Emperor and received permission.

sen.j: 700年（文武天皇4年）6月17日 (旧暦) - 文武天皇の命を受け、藤原不比等、粟田眞人らとともに律令を選定する。
sen.e: On July 11, 700, he received order from the Emperor Monmu and selected the Ritsuryo codes with FUJIWARA no Fuhito, AWATA no Mahito and others.
On July 11, 700 or June 17 on the old calendar, he received order from the Emperor Monmu and selected the Ritsuryo codes with FUJIWARA no Fuhito, AWATA no Mahito and others.

sen.j: 701年（大宝 (日本)元年）4月7日 (旧暦) - 文武天皇の命により、古麻呂ら3人が初めて新令を講義する。
sen.e: On May 23, 701, they lectured on the new codes for the first time by order of the Emperor Monmu.

sen.j: 親王、諸臣、百官に受講させた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince, shoshin (retainers) and all the officials took the lectures.

sen.cmt: ・親王は複数いたと思われるので複数形に修正しました。

sen.j: 701年（大宝元年）8月3日 (旧暦) - 文武天皇の命により三品の忍壁皇子、正三位の藤原不比等、従五位下の伊吉博徳、伊予部馬養らとともに選定していた大宝律令が完成した。
sen.e: Taiho Code, which was selected by Komaro, Osakabe no Miko (Prince Osakabe), Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank), FUJIWARA no Fuhito, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), IKI no Hakatoko, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), IYOBE no Umakai and others by order of the Emperor Monmu, was completed on September 13, 701.

sen.e: Granted Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and appointed to Hyobukyo (Minister for Military Affairs) on May 23, 705.

sen.j: 707年（慶雲4年）3月22日 (旧暦) - 下毛野石代（下毛野朝臣石代）の性を下毛野川内朝臣とすることを請い、これが許される。
